headline: Grilled Flat Iron Steak with Blue Cheese-Chive Butter
description: I made this up as a Valentine's Day dinner. The butter is what makes this dish.
name: Grilled Flat Iron Steak with Blue Cheese-Chive Butter

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk together vinegar, garlic, 1 tablespoon black pepper, rosemary, oregano, and kosher salt in a bowl along with the olive oil. Place the flat iron steak into a resealable plastic bag, and pour the marinade overtop. Squeeze the excess air from the bag and seal. Marinate in the refrigerator 30 minutes.

Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil grate. Remove steak from the marinade, shake off excess, and discard the remaining marinade. Allow the steak to stand at room temperature for 15 minutes as the grill warms.

Mash together the butter, blue cheese, chives, and 1/8 teaspoon of black pepper; set aside. Cook the steak on the preheated grill to desired degree of doneness, about 5 minutes per side for medium-rare. Allow the steak to rest in a warm place for 10 minutes before slicing thinly across the grain. Serve with a dollop of blue cheese-chive butter.

review.reviewBody:
I didn't have the ingredients for the butter, but we loved the steak by itself. It marinated for about 1-1 1/2 hours, and turned out spot on. Went well together with boiled corn and grilled asparagus and peppers. 
Will try it with the butter next time.

The marinade is awesome. The blue cheese butter on it was ok. I would stick to the marinade, add the butter and some garlic at the end and spoon it on. I did not like the blue cheese on the steak. A burger topped with it would have been better.

I tried this and loved it.
I substituted filet mignon instead of the flat iron and didn’t marinate it, but only added salt and pepper. Since it was over 2 inches thick I cooked it an additional minute or two per side and instead of making the blue cheese butter dip I just had it plain. 

Except for the expensive meat this is a great recipe, I will try it again.
I just got done eating and it was excellent! The only change was a little bit more Blue Cheese in the butter and it was perfect! I will definitely be making this again!
I will make it again. The blue cheese and chive butter is awesome.
I marinated the steak for 3 hours. Heated the grill to 425 and cooked the flat iron steak for 2 mins on each side. Steak was medium rare and tender; absolutely DELISH.
I made it a couple days ago, so delicious. And the butter was such an added treat
Yum!!! Simple and delicious, and a big hit with the hubs for Valentine's Day dinner!

This is a delicious dish! My family really enjoyed it! I didn’t have chives for the bleu cheese butter, so I chopped up some scallions and added them to the mixture. It was the perfect topper for the steak. I’ll definitely be making this again!
Husband loved it—he is still talking about it. Will make again, probably for guests, too!
It was great

I pretty much follow the recipe, but marinade longer. Did it the first time on the grill, after that I put it on the smoker. It's thin so it smokes very quickly, but the flavor the smoke adds was incredible. I highly recommend you try it if you have a smoker! I used plum wood simply because that was all I had on hand at the time.
Very good, but I marinated it overnight.

This was just an okay marinade. I did let the steak marinade for almost 2 hrs. and we still couldn't really taste it. I'll just stick to a little olive oil and salt and pepper. The blue cheese butter was really good, especially on bread. 
Thanks for the recipe.

This was great!! I did use sirloin instead I doubled the recipe, also 1/2 as much oregano, only because I don't really like oregano other than those two things I really did not change anything else. All in all it was a really nice steak recipe with tons of flavor.
Sorry to say we did not like the marinade at all. I ended up rinsing it off the meat after cooking and using the meat in a stir fry dish. The meat was very tender, though.
Very good marinade. Didn't make the blue cheese butter.
Wonderful! Only change was to double all ingredients! Very elegant dinner!

I made this tonight, I didn't have a grill so I sautéed the steaks in the marinade over high heat. 4 minutes for the first side, 3 minutes for the second. Served with a side of French fries. It came out amazing!

This was almost TOO good... I wasn't prepared for all the flavor that comes with it. There were several ingredients in it that my boyfriend doesn't like but I love (mainly the Bleu cheese) but I made it exactly as directed anyway. I waited for a comment after I gave it to him and in minutes his plate was cleared and he told me anytime I make steak in the future I should make it exactly like this. Fine by me!!
I loved this. It was very tasty!

I made this for my fiance and he absolutely loved it! he said it's THE best steak he's every had. He enjoyed it so much, he had me make it for a group of friends we had over for a bbq and it was a hit with them too. I will make this over and over again in he coming years.
Didn't change a thing except I used venison steaks! So yummy!
This is an excellent recipe. The meat is flavorful and tender and the topping brings it to perfection
This was amazing. My husband and I always use our "go to" seasoning for steak but wanted to try something different. We were oohing and awing the entire meal. Perfect!

Simple. Delicious. Didn't change a thing except I got busy and had to let it marinate over night. I don't know if there is a difference but we thought it was great. The bleu cheese and butter are. the. bomb. Served with spinach wilted with shallots and garlic, also great. Thanks Kristen. Got some NY Strips yesterday, going to use the rest of the chive/cheese/butter for sure.
Was excellent! I didn't have any chives, but had some fresh green onions-just as good!

Flat iron steak used to be a great inexpensive cut that was a delight to eat.

Now it is $6.99 lb....not very cheap
Flat iron is my favorite inexpensive cut of meat. I've done this with both blue butter and with feta cheese butter. Each is delicious!
Excellent! Steak comes out so juicy and flavorful. Love this recipe.

Execellent. I don't like blue cheese, but this butter was wonderful. I think next time I will try top sirloin. I have never tried flat iron steak and it was very nice, but it was very fatty. The fatty meat issue maybe my poor selection of the meat at the store. I am just starting to cook, so I may need to look at better meat departments.

The blue cheeze-chive butter is amazing, especially with more blue cheese and less butter. Extra thick top sirloin cooked black and blue! Then under the broiler to give the blue cheese a sort of crust on top! You can't go wrong with asparagus, a little butter, little coarse ground sea salt, a little coarse ground peppercorns! This is a great dish!
Very good steak marinade. But what made the dish was the blue-cheese butter. So good!
Loved it...

Flat iron steak (or any beef these days) is so hit and miss. This would have been great with a tenderloin or a usda prime sirloin. Flat iron cuts in my area (Arizona) have been very tough no matter how you cook them.
I made this without changes. I have to say my family absolutely loved it. The presentation of the steak once sliced up and plated is womderful.
Marinated overnight. I used a quarter less oil. Halved the salt (onion salt). Filet mignonette tender!

This was fantastic. Prepared exactly as instructed. My wife loved it but thought it was a little too greasy. LOTS of Butter, oil, and cheese.
You might cut down on the butter and oil if that's a concern. I wouldn't change a thing.
Extremely good. Pound the steak, and use Gorgonzola in the butter. Perfect with a baked potato.
Recipe is now #1

The local grocery had "flat iron steaks" on sale. So... I had to try it. Based on quantity of reviews I opted for this recipe. Most of my family dislikes blue cheese, so I was lucky to find 'blue cheese butter' already mixed in the grocery gourmet section. I was happy to buy that for a few dollars vs. all the ingredients for higher cost. Guess what? NO topping necessary! The meat was tender and delicious marinated and grilled. This recipe (minus topping) will be a staple for us now. As for the blue cheese butter -- turns out it's pretty good on 'loaded' sandwiches. (you know, with tomato, lettuce, avocado, etc.)

just wow.. where do i begin.. this came out awesome.. we had a 1.8 lb steak and used the recipe for a 2.25 lb steak.. like others im sure this would have been tasty even w/o the butter sauce.. made it super rare.. we like our steak still mooing.. bf says rip the horns off and still hear it screaming.. as for the sauce we doubled the pepper and instead of using chives used 1/4 t of onion powder.. ty so much for this recipe

This is a yummy recipe! My boyfriend craves and requests this all the time. I followed the prepping to a T but I live in a condo so had to broil my steak instead. I've had numerous cuts and each time I eyeballed it on the broiler set to high. Definitely a quick and yummy meal

So good!! And easy, too. Followed it as written and won't make a change next time, either. I was pleasantly surprised how little time it took to cook the flat iron... had never used that cut before. Thanks for a YUMMY recipe!

This was amazing! The marinade gave the meat a really good flavor and the chive, blue cheese butter was yummy. I cooked the meat for the time given, 5 minutes on each side, and it was more rare than medium rare. This actually worked out, because after I sliced it, I put the butter over the slices and put it into the oven for about 5 minutes until it was more medium rare. This melted the butter all over the meat!
I did not like the blue cheese butter
My boys loved this! Will definitely make again.

All I can is AWESOME. First time I made it so I didn't change anything. I give it 5 stars and next time I will do it the same.. Save yourself some money and cook this steak at home and we had the asparagus stuffed potatoes on this site...
The marinade is good, but I was most looking forward to the blue cheese butter. I was not happy with it.

I didn't make this steak, but I did make the butter and used it on some bbq'ed steaks (done in my normal way) and I would give it 6 stars if I could. 

Thank you!
Incredible. I cooked it on a grill pan on the stove rather than a grill and it came out almost perfect. Marinade was amazing and the blue cheese-chive butter was unbelievable on top of the steak.
The butter is delicious!
This is a go-to dinner for my husband and I! It's delicious and tastes like it's from a high end restaurant. I make it exactly as stated in recipe, but cook it on my indoor grill pan.

I love this recipe! I have made it over and over again. The marinade is fine, it's the butter that is amazing. I have served it to many folks who claim they hate blue cheese and they all loved it! I think it is because the melting process/heat seems to make the cheese taste a little less sharp.
This on top of a garlic crustini is just amazing! I used ribeye instead of a flat iron steak and it worked great.
I followed the recipe and steak was excellent! Also loved the blue-cheese chive butter.
Marinade is perfection. Love the blue cheese butter!
We love this recipe! We use it on all different cuts of steak and the blue cheese chive butter puts it over the top.

So so good. I made as written except I went to get blue cheese and was out so I substituted some really good local made feta. I'll try it next time with the blue cheese but the feta was really wonderful too.
Marinated for 6 hours. Hubby loved this steak!

This was good! I doubled the amount of the butter ingredients to be sure to have enough. We had over half the steak and butter for leftovers. Don't use the microwave to soften the leftover butter mixture--it didn't work so well. But the first night--the whole meal was awesome!

We loved it! I marinaded the stake for 3 hours only because that's when I had the time to do it. Also, to make it slightly healthier, I didn't add the butter. I sprinkled some blue cheese on the steak right after I pulled it off the grill. i don't know what it would have tasted like if i did use the butter, but I can tell you the steak we had was wonderful!
Everything was fabulous.

This butter is amazing! Thank goodness I doubled it! I used the marinade on thick sirloin steaks, since my husband (a meat cutter) can't stand flat iron steaks. Steaks were tender, butter was amazing, and our guests left begging for the recipe. Thanks!
Blue Cheese Topping makes this!

De-li-cious! Followed the recipe to a t (almost, that is- I did substitute green onions for chives)...and the steak was super moist and flavorful on its own...but add the blue cheese butter and it is heaven! (Surprising that we loved it because we are not huge blue cheese fans!)
I wont bore you with the details, wow!!

This was fantastic! The steak is very good, but the chive/butter sauce was pretty much the highlight of the meal. I served this with asparagus and red potatoes. The boyfriend practically licked the plate! I will definitely use this recipe again, and the sauce with any steak will be fantastic.

Marinade is very good! Let the steak marinate for a few hours before cooking. I love flat iron steak and have been buying it for quite awhile. I don't like blue cheese, so I didn't use it on my steak, but my husband did and he loved it. I used the garlic butter from this site. Excellent.

I did not use the Blue Cheese part because I did not have the ingredients but the marinade was something I will always use when I make a Flat Iron Steak, I was never impressed with this steak but this marinade brought it over the top!
OMG, this recipe is awesome. Didn't change a thing!!
This is a really good marinade, and I've made the butter before for other steaks as well and it's delicious.

This was really good. The blue cheese butter was delicious and really made the dish. The grilling instructions for the steak were spot on, and the marinade was tasty. A little more salt in the marinade and it would be perfect. Thanks!
The marinade is wonderful. I use fresh rosemary. The blue cheese butter makes a fine compliment.

This was delicious!!!!! We used sirloin instead of Flat Iron and green onions instead of chives, but otherwise followed everything else to a T. This is definitely a keeper, in fact, we'll probably make it again next week!
I have made this several times, and my family--even my picky daughter--loves it. I have eaten flat iron in restaurants, and am glad I can have it at home as well. Thanks to Kristin!
Very good. My husband loved this recipe and wants to make sure he sees it once a month! Thanks you.
Used this recipe for a flat iron steak, and it was AMAZING!

This recipe is soooo dang good! Instead of using Flat Iron Steak, I used a filet mingon which was perfect. The butter melted right into the meat which was tender and juicy. Cannot wait to make it again!!

Excellent flavor but I should have let my meat marinate longer. I used a chuck steak, that had some fat throughout, and marinated it for about 30-45 minutes. It was chewable but still kind of tough in my opinion. I didn't have any chives so I just mixed the blue cheese and butter together and sat it on top of the steaks after they are done. This was good but not great. Maybe I really did need the chives. I would make this again but will definitely use a different cut of steak and let it marinate longer.
My family loved this recipe! We are not big fans of blue cheese but it complimented the meat perfectly! My 9 year old daughter even raved over it!
This was soooo awesome! Didn't change anything. The marinade and the butter made it the dish. I will make this again and again.
it must have been me

OMG!!! This was amazing. I never write reviews, but had to write one for this recipe. Everyone asked how they were seasoned and marinated. My picky 14 year old daughter came and found me to tell me these were amazing! We have decided to use this recipe on all our steaks and try it with grilled chicken as well. Better than an upscale steak house!
Very good marinade. Didn't make the blue cheese butter.

I was cooking steaks one night for 2 friends and myself. My two friends wanted just plain steak but I'm not a big fan of steak by itself. I was planning on making this recipe but only using the blue cheese butter on my steak. Even though my two friends don't like blue cheese they both decided to try the blue cheese butter once everything was ready and they both loved it. I will definitely make this again.
Excellent. Use a little less rosemary.
perfect. sooo good. used new york instead, but wouldnt change a thing else.
Loved it! My family loved it too!
My family loved this! I marinated the meat for about 8 hours - next time I will try to do it over night. In addition to the bleu cheese butter I also made garlic butter and both were well received.
it was AMAZING! made with a london broil!
This was wonderful and so easy to make, I did use flank steak and it was great!!
love this recipe! i used a T-bone steak for the flavor of the bone! came out great! made baked potatoes and homemade macaroni salad as sides. thanks for the great recipe!
Delish, even though I normally don't like blue cheese.
Very good and very easy. I loved the Blue Cheese butter. I forgot the chives so had to leave that out, and I used a wedge of Lauging Cow Blue Cheese.
Great taste! May want to use a better cut of meat
The butter-cheese sauce is the thing. Will be good on any cut of steak
The marinade is perfect for this steak and the blue cheese spread absolutely makes the dish. Can't wait to try it on a burger
I wanted this to be great, esp. from all the glowing reviews. Followed the recipe to the letter.....meh! The steak was way better without the butter....and even that was nothing particularly special.

item.name: Grilled Flat Iron Steak with Blue Cheese-Chive Butter
